info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 23 at 8:07PM MDT until June 23 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... East central Grant County in southwestern New Mexico... Southeastern Sierra County in south central New Mexico... Northern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Central Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 900 PM MDT.
* At 804 PM MDT, outflow from thunderstorms in far southern New Mexico was pushing north of the I-10 corridor. Wind gusts of 45 mph and visibility of three quarters of a mile have been reported at Las Cruces Airport. The outflow will conitnue to carry dust north through the Hatch Valley and the lower Mimbres Valley in the next hour. Wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph will be possible. This outflow may finally trigger shower and thunderstorm development in its wake as it pushes north this evening.
HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 45 mph.
SOURCE...Doppler radar.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 138 and 146. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 53. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 164.
Locations impacted include... Hatch, Upham, Leasburg, Faywood, Nutt, Rincon, Las Cruces, Jornada Range, Radium Springs, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Derry, Salem, Lake Valley, Garfield, Fairacres, Organ, Mesilla, Talavera, and Butterfield Trail Estates.
info.instruction: Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: Dona Ana, NM; Grant, NM; Luna, NM; Sierra, NM
